lexUnit.name: circle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move in a circle around

sentence.text: Black-headed gulls ( ` cawdy-mawdies " ) circled the fields as we walked : ` White cawdy-mawdies slow swiver and sail . "
We hooked ourselves up , circled the field , and on a signal from the R.A.F. officer , Lt. Lewes and Davies dived out .
She was circling the room with an almost predatory air , examining each painting , each piece of furniture , and it was not appreciation that was etched on her face .
They both had their fists in the air and circled round each other .
We circled round the island , which is little more than a circular shingle bar with a lagoon in the middle .

The vultures are already circling around Howard Kendall , suggesting Everton 's slump to third from bottom of the Premier League is confirmation of his folly in returning to the scene of his greatest triumphs .
As the plane circled in wide sweeps , each one lower than the other , the Pack did pray -- silently , sincerely -- Brown Owl with them .
As they did so , the plane circled lower .
Birds circled in the dark sky .
After release the pigeon circles a few times around the release site for a few minutes and then flies off , usually in the approximate direction of its home loft .
Theodora circled the house in the direction of the arrow and came round to the back door .
We circled several times in the over-laden boat .
A security drone circled like a fat , lazy insect in front of the door to the Conference Room .
He took careful aim with his second barrel at a smaller buffalo that had begun circling in dismay , and they heard the dull thud of his successful shot echo clearly across the plain .
Bob was circling on his own horse , waiting for me .
It circled me now , yowling and screaming in a noxious way .
Grumpily I circled the church ( Michelin one star ) , bought a newspaper , drank a cup of coffee , read about the charcutier , fou d'amour , and decided to take the next train back .
The glider circled the escarpment and was carried with the warm air currents into the upper atmosphere .
The dog circled him , barking .
The idea circled round Barbara 's mind .
He circled the house , looking in , and saw nothing but the bits and pieces of ordinary living .
Hoffmann made a wide approach and circled .
